newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Profit lift pulls G.E. Crane shares up.
newsitem.headline: Profit lift pulls G.E. Crane shares up.

text.p: Shares in G.E. Crane Holdings Ltd strengthened over two percent after the plumbing and building supplies group posted a 41 percent higher net profit of A$28.95 million for the 12 months to June 30.
The improved result was struck on 5.8 percent higher revenues of A$945.04 million.
The company also took an upbeat view on near term prospects, saying it expected business conditions to improve in the six months to December 31, 1997 and become stonger after that.
"It's obviously a strong result and things could be even better," said a dealer at a Sydney-based investment bank, although he noted the light business in the traditionally thinly traded stock.
Just ten trades made up the 137,055 shares through the market by 12.15 p.m. (0215 GMT), by which time G.E. Crane shares were 22 cents higher at A$13.52.
